definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: Reductions in construction jobs limit growth, further depressing housing markets.
sentences.chinese: 承包工程的減少抑制了增長，進一步使得房市慘淡。

sentences.english: But beyond the glow of this sudden efflorescence , a housing bubble had begun to form.
sentences.chinese: 但在突如其來繁盛的光輝之外，房市泡沫開始形成。

sentences.english: Any perking up in the housing market would be a signal that we're on the mend.
sentences.chinese: 房市任何程度的活躍都將是我們開始好轉的信號。

sentences.english: That's why we're seeing market-cooling measures trickling out of Beijing, the Economist reports
sentences.chinese: 這就是我們看到北京不斷出臺給房市降溫的舉措。

sentences.english: Shanghai will launch a large-scale attack a more speculative property market speculation storm.
sentences.chinese: 上海將掀起一股更大規模的打擊房市投機炒作的風暴。

sentences.english: Mr. Reisinger views the housing slump as a blessing in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 雷辛格認爲房市衰退可謂是塞翁失馬。

sentences.english: The lowering of interest rates, may experts believe, would give a great boost to the house market.
sentences.chinese: 許多專家相信，利率調降可以大大的帶動房市買氣。

sentences.english: Joblessness is a drag on the housing market, with many people no longer able to afford their homes.
sentences.chinese: 失業率是房市的一大阻礙，因爲失業的人供不起房。

sentences.english: However the slowdown in economic activity has spread outside the housing sector.
sentences.chinese: 不過，經濟活動的減緩已經擴展到房市以外的行業。

sentences.english: Why is it taking so long for the housing market to sort itself out?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼那麼長的時間過去了，房市還是如此低靡呢？

sentences.english: Shao said housing prices are determined by the supply and demand of the property market.
sentences.chinese: 邵寧表示，房價是由房市的供給和需求決定。

sentences.english: Another couple of twitches were detected in moribund housing markets.
sentences.chinese: 另一個讓人抽搐的消息來自奄奄一息的房市。

sentences.english: AT THE ripe old age of five years, America’s housing bust is still very much alive and kicking.
sentences.chinese: 美國崩潰的房市在經歷滄桑的五年後，依然十分頹廢。

definition: financial leverage/leveraging (i.e. buying shares on borrowed funds)
hot money, money flowing from one currency to another in the hope of quick profit
second-hand house/house acquired indirectly through a middle-man
